summary: User wants a zero-cost, fully automated camera-based app that monitors an online quiz on a PC screen, performs OCR, queries a free-tier LLM to determine correct multiple-choice answers, and displays the answer hands-free in a continuous loop.
architectural_notes: Target 'zero-cost' architecture: client-side/on-device OCR plus free-tier LLM APIs with user-supplied API keys
Automated pipeline loop: capture frame every ~3s -> OCR -> similarity/change detection -> LLM query only on change -> update UI -> repeat
State management to store last question text and prevent redundant LLM calls
Rate-limit/backoff strategy for free-tier LLM quota errors with UI countdown feedback

existing_features.title: Implement a single-screen React UI that provides (1) a live camera viewfinder using browser MediaDevices/WebRTC, (2) a visible transparent target box overlay to guide alignment, and (3) a bottom results panel that shows extracted text, status, and the most recent saved capture.

Add an automated hands-free capture loop that, when started, captures an image from the live camera feed every 3 seconds, restricted to the target box region, and runs client-side OCR on that region to extract text.

Implement change detection to avoid repeated processing of the same on-screen content by comparing the newly extracted OCR text to the previously accepted text and only treating it as “new content” when similarity drops below an 80% match threshold.

Add blur/glare/blank rejection: if OCR output contains fewer than 15 characters (after trimming whitespace), discard the frame, display a status indicating insufficient text, and do not create a new saved capture.

Provide a “Study Assistant” output mode that stays within an ethical use case: show the extracted text and offer utilities such as “Copy extracted text”, “Save as study note”, and optional local summarization placeholder UI WITHOUT generating or presenting “the correct option/answer” for live tests.

Persist saved captures (study notes) in the Motoko backend so they survive refresh/reload, including: an auto-generated id, extractedText, createdAt timestamp, and an optional user-provided title/tag. Provide backend methods to create, list (most recent first), and delete notes.
Add basic error handling and safe pausing: if OCR throws an error or camera stream fails, stop the loop automatically, surface a readable error message, and provide a one-click retry.

Create and apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) for a dark-mode “scanner” aesthetic using Tailwind and existing UI primitives, and enforce it consistently across the screen (viewfinder, overlays, controls, results panel, notes list).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a fully automated camera-based real-time quiz answering assistant that monitors a PC screen and returns the correct MCQ option without manual interaction
Implement zero-cost OCR using on-device/client-side libraries (Tesseract.js or Google ML Kit) to extract quiz text from camera frames
Integrate free-tier LLM provider support (e.g., Gemini API or Groq/Llama 3) with API-key placeholder configuration
Create single-screen UI with live camera viewfinder + target box overlay and a results panel with Start/Stop automation toggle and status indicators
Add automated loop with periodic frame capture, OCR, question change detection (80% similarity threshold), and answer update without re-querying same question
Add edge-case handling: blur/glare rejection (min text length), and free-tier rate-limit handling with automatic backoff/countdown

projectName: Camera-based OCR study assistant with automated capture loop and saved study notes (no exam/quiz cheating)
